headline: Program Manager, Laboratories and Scientific Services Directorate, at U.S. Customs and Border Protection
summary:
Seasoned IT Director providing leadership and management for an IT department using state-of-the-art technologies for the enterprise. Excellent customer service, communication, and negotiation skills.

Specialties: Program/Project Management (PMP), Budgeting, Strategic Planning, Business Process Improvement, IT Policy, Computer security, ITIL, IT Infrastructure, Unix systems administration, IT leadership/management

defaultPosition.companyName: DHS -- U.S. Customs and Border Protection
defaultPosition.description:
Program Manager for Laboratories and Scientific Services Directorate Facilities Portfolio responsible for acquisitions, design & construction and facilities management for 8 regional forensics laboratories and 10 satellite labs nationwide. 

Recent Training -- Leading Complex Projects (May 2018)
defaultPosition.title: Program Manager, Laboratories and Scientific Services Facilities Portfolio

positions.companyName: DHS -- U.S. Customs and Border Protection
positions.description:
Program Manager for Laboratories and Scientific Services Directorate Facilities Portfolio responsible for acquisitions, design & construction and facilities management for 8 regional forensics laboratories and 10 satellite labs nationwide. 

Recent Training -- Leading Complex Projects (May 2018)
positions.title: Program Manager, Laboratories and Scientific Services Facilities Portfolio

positions.companyName: Department of Homeland Security - US Customs and Border Protection
positions.description:
IT Program Manager at US Customs and Border Protection for nation-wide multi-million dollar IT Facilities Infrastructure and Design/Construction Projects ranging from leasing Class A office space to build-to-suit specialized scientific/forensics laboratories. Manage facilities acquisition, portfolio management, managing program of requirements, strategic planning of capital investments and operating budgets.

RECENT TRAINING:
-- Master's Certificate in Project Management by GWU, Washington DC - July 2014
-- Agile Product Owner - April 2014
-- Agile Scrum Master - April 2014
-- PMP (Project Management Professional) Certified by PMI Organization on July 19, 2010
-- ITIL v3 (IT service management) - August 2012
-- Advanced Earned Value Management, GWU, Nov. 2011
-- Contracting Officer Technical Representative Certification, GWU, August 2011
positions.title: Program Manager

positions.description: Real estate marketing and sales consulting services in the residential and commercial markets of DC, MD, and VA.
positions.title: Owner/Principle Broker

positions.description:
Program Manager Lead supervising 10+ contractors at the U.S. Department of Homeland Security, U.S. Customs and Border Protection providing facilities program and construction management services.

RECENT TRAINING: Principles in Project Management - PMP Prep.
positions.title: Program Manager

positions.description: Provided leadership and management of the IT department. Responsible for strategy, budget, hiring, staff, customer service and stakeholder satisfaction, planning and executing projects which upgraded infrastructure and implemented custom and COTS software applications. Responsible for help desk, network and infrastructure management, systems and database management, software development, and computer security.
positions.title: Director of Information Technology

positions.description: Directed the implementation of a secure Criminal Intelligence and Investigations Information System (network, hardware, software) which was utilized by 500+ police detectives to aid them in solving crimes.
positions.title: Supervisory Computer Specialist

positions.description:
Provided consulting services to agencies, and managed multiple projects. Supervised engineers, computer specialists, contractors, and functioned as project team leader
Managed projects from conceptualization stage to final system implementation, pre and post project implementation activities, including installation of network cabling, hardware, and software installation/integration, database conversion, training, and acceptance testing
Defined user requirements and developed software/hardware specifications in a RFP for a $1 million Washington Area Criminal Intelligence Information System which automated detective functions. Coordinated with procurement, functioned as contracting officer's technical representative (COTR), chaired committees to evaluate vendor proposals, and recommended contract awards
positions.title: Computer Specialist - Project Manager

positions.description: Reported to the CEO of the hospital at a 560-bed non-profit hospital in Corpus Christi, Texas. Was a key member of the IT steering committee to upgrade and integrate the hospital information systems for the nursing and clinical departments. Managed a staff of industrial engineers and oversaw several business process engineering projects, in the areas of admissions, radiology, operating room, and medical/surgical nursing floors.
positions.title: Director of Management Engineering

positions.description: Managed a group of 9 professional Industrial Engineers in a company which manufactured oil drilling tools.
positions.title: Supervisor of Industrial Engineering

positions.description: Manufacturer of cigarettes and exporter of tobaccos to U.K., Europe, Japan, etc. Supervised nine plant superintendents and foreman and 650 production workers in a 24x7 3 shift operation. Located in India. Owned 40% by British American Tobacco of UK.
positions.title: Assistant Plant Manager
